section.title: Load an image from your plugin
section.para: To load an image from your plug-in your use the AbstractUIPlugin .
Alternatively you could load the framework directly.

section.title: Save users layout
section.para: To remember the user's layout and window size for the next time you start your application, add configurer.setSaveAndRestore(true); to the initialize method of ApplicationWorkbenchAdvisor.
Eclipse has a pre-defined command to reset the perspective. See Eclipse Commands .

section.title: Accessing the status line
section.para: The status line in an RCP application can be used to give the user some information about the running application. The shared message area can be used by all parts of the application to write messages to this area. The whole RCP application has access to the information in the shared status line therefore the information in the shared status line might be overwritten.
To show the status line in your RCP application use the "ApplicationWorkbenchWindowAdvisor" and set the status line visible in the method preWindowOpen().

section.title: Finding unused dependencies
section.para: In the file plugin.xml (tab dependencies) you define on which plugins your plug-in depends. Of course you should only define the required plugins here. You can check if you have any dependency maintained which is actually not used, by selecting Dependency Analysis -> Find unused dependencies.

section.title: Multi-User settings
section.para: Eclipse RCP applications save configuration files in the folder ".metadata". In the standard settings the Eclipse RCP installation directory will be used for this folder. If several users are using the same installation folder, then you should supply the parameter "-data" to specify an alternative location. If you specify the value "@user.home/applicationname" the configuration will be saved in a user specific folder.
